page.title: 14Tourism & transport
page.content: There are 3 officially recognised farm campsites in the area. Reasons for tourism being proximity of sea, Oulton Broad, local scenery and historic buildings. There are no regular public transport services through Henstead or Rushmere. The A12 is the nearest regular bus stop route northwards into Lowestoft or south to various towns and ultimately to Ipswich. Every Tuesday a bus leaves Henstead at 9.30am returning at noon to carry shoppers into Beccles. 19% of the sample study group used a taxi service from time to time, the firms being based in Lowestoft. Private transport is therefore essential. 75% of households studied owned a car, 35% had 2. 95% of cars were in daily use. 31% of households owned a motorcycle /moped, 80% used daily. 75% had bikes 66% were in daily use.
